hanzi-su-wiki:
課

Значения

Штрафовать, облагать налогом, задание, урок, отдел (учреждения)

Мнемоника

Речь 言, приносящая плоды 果, гадание. По иной версии — риторика, умение убеждать или заставлять платить налоги.

Варианты

课

heisig_chinese_memo: After I finish each chapter, I eat a piece of fruit to celebrate all the new words I've learned in the lesson.
heisig_constituent: chapter, say, words, keitai, mouth, fruit, rice field, brains, tree, wood
Keyword_KANJIDIC: chapter, lesson, section, department, division, counter for chapters (of a book)
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: глава, урок, раздел, отдел, подразделение, счетчик для глав (книги)
koohiiStory1: After I finish each chapter of RTK, I eat a piece of fruit to celebrate all the new words I´ve learned. (Thanks Misha!).
koohiiStory2: Words signify the written words in a book. The fruit represents something whole, complete. A chapter in a book often offers a complete idea, setting, or account. It´s good to disambiguate the keyword from paragraph (#82). To reinforce the kanji, imagine eating a fruit at the end of each chapter of Tolstoy´s "War and Peace" to reward yourself. (If you ate a fruit at the end of each paragraph, you´d very quickly run out of fruit).

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: I always say the fruit section at the grocery should be at the front of the store. It’s the perfect place for the fruit section, I say.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Think about it. Every grocery store has the fruit section right at the front, wouldn’t you say?
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: To get to the fruit section, you have to go to the store. To get to the store you have to drive a car (か). Driving a car is the fastest way to get to the fruit section at the store.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture yourself driving a car and salivating over the fruit waiting for you in the fruit section. Imagine your favorite fruit as you put the pedal to the metal in your awesome car.

Ru_trainchinese:
kè: (сущ) урок; предмет, курс; учебное занятие, аудиторное занятие
kè: (графема) налог; взимать, собирать (налог); сеанс гадания
Kanshudo_mnemonic: words (言) that give results (果) are a lesson
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You will only get the fruit (benefit) from the words unless you finsh the whole lesson.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " speak " and " fruit ", the original meaning is inspection. "Shuowen": "Try it. Congyan, fruitful sound." "Guanzi·Seven Methods": "The finished weapon is not used in class. If you don't try it, you don't hide it." Yin Zhizhang's note: "Although the weapon is built, it has not been tested in class. There is no need not to hide."

" Class " can mean supervision. "The Book of the Later Han·The Biography of Fangshu·Ren Wengong": "Wang Mang usurped, Wen Gong pushed the numbers, knowing that when the chaos is great, the class members are burdened with a hundred catties and tend to go away."

" Class " also means calculation. "Nine Chapters of Arithmetic-Fang Tian": "Lesson points." Li Chunfeng's note: "Different names are different, but the reason is not the same. There are many numbers in the school, so the lesson is also divided."

" Class " also refers to taxation and collection of taxes. It means taxation such as "Sui Shu·Shihuozhi": "For his class, Ding Nan adjusts cloth and silk for two feet each... the male year is sixteen, half a class, eighteenth year is a regular class, sixty-six is exempt from class." "Book of Yi Zhou‧ Da Kuang": "Nonglin is divided into townships, and the township is ordered to receive food. Cheng Ke collects goods, competes and compares to Tibet."

Study and lecture can also be expressed as " class ". "Liangshu‧The Legend of the Scholars‧Shen Jun": "With his uncle, Tai Shi Shuming, the teacher and ancestor Shen Tushi, he spent years under his sect and taught himself day and night."

" Class " also means homework. Tang Li Shangyin's "Miscellaneous Compilation-Lost Noumenon": "If you don't check students for class, don't study, you lose your master's body."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " yan " and " fruit ", the original meaning is inspection.
humanum_full_description:
從「言」，「果」聲，本義為檢驗。《說文》：「試也。从言，果聲。」《管子‧七法》：「成器不課不用，不試不藏。」尹知章注：「兵器雖成，未經課試，則不用不藏。」

　　「課」可表示督促。《後漢書‧方術傳上‧任文公》：「王莽篡後，文公推數，知當大亂，乃課家人負物百斤，環舍趨走。」

　　「課」也表示計算。《九章算術‧方田》：「課分。」李淳風注：「分各異名，理不齊一，校其相多之數，故曰課分也。」

　　「課」還指賦稅及徵收賦稅。表示賦稅如《隋書‧食貨志》：「其課，丁男調布絹各二丈……男年十六，亦半課，年十八正課，六十六免課。」表示徵收賦稅如《逸周書‧大匡》：「農廩分鄉，鄉命受糧。程課物徵，躬競比藏。」

　　學習、講習也可以「課」表示。《梁書‧儒林傳‧沈峻》：「與舅太史叔明師事宗人沈驎士，在門下積年，晝夜自課。」

　　「課」亦表示作業。唐李商隱《雜纂‧失本體》：「不點檢學生作課，不念書，失先生體。」

課課RS
课课 		lesson, course, classwork
  • words 言 that bear fruit 果 later
(Simplified: 课)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 果 indicates the sound; 言 (speech) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 言 [ yán ] words, speech; to speak, to say
    • 果 [ guǒ ] fruit, nut; result
①教學上的一個階段：上課。課時。課間。曠課。授課。課餘活動。
②教學的科目：課程。課表。基礎課。專業課。課本。課文。
③教書講學或攻讀學習：課徒。課讀。
④古代的一種賦稅：國課。完糧交課。
⑤使交納賦稅：課稅。課役。
⑥機關、企業等行政上的單位(現亦稱“科”)：會計課。
⑦迷信占卜的一種：起課。

從「 言 」，「 果 」聲，本義為檢驗。《說文》：「試也。从言，果聲。」《管子‧七法》：「成器不課不用，不試不藏。」尹知章注：「兵器雖成，未經課試，則不用不藏。」 「 課 」可表示督促。《後漢書‧方術傳上‧任文公》：「王莽篡後，文公推數，知當大亂，乃課家人負物百斤，環舍趨走。」 「 課 」也表示計算。《九章算術‧方田》：「課分。」李淳風注：「分各異名，理不齊一，校其相多之數，故曰課分也。」 「 課 」還指賦稅及徵收賦稅。表示賦稅如《隋書‧食貨志》：「其課，丁男調布絹各二丈……男年十六，亦半課，年十八正課，六十六免課。」表示徵收賦稅如《逸周書‧大匡》：「農廩分鄉，鄉命受糧。程課物徵，躬競比藏。」 學習、講習也可以「 課 」表示。《梁書‧儒林傳‧沈峻》：「與舅太史叔明師事宗人沈驎士，在門下積年，晝夜自課。」 「 課 」亦表示作業。唐李商隱《雜纂‧失本體》：「不點檢學生作課，不念書，失先生體。」
From the sound of " speak" and " fruit", the original meaning is inspection. "Shuowen": "Try it. Congyan, fruitful sound." "Guanzi·Seven Methods": "The finished weapon is not used in class. If you don't try it, you don't hide it." Yin Zhizhang's note: "Although the weapon is built, it has not been tested in class. There is no need not to hide." " Class" can mean supervision. "The Book of the Later Han·The Biography of Fangshu·Ren Wengong": "Wang Mang usurped, Wen Gong pushed the numbers, knowing that when the chaos is great, the class members are burdened with a hundred catties and tend to go away." " Class" also means calculation. "Nine Chapters of Arithmetic-Fang Tian": "Lesson points." Li Chunfeng's note: "Different names are different, but the reason is not the same. There are many numbers in the school, so the lesson is also divided." " Class" also refers to taxation and collection of taxes. It means taxation such as "Sui Shu·Shihuozhi": "For his class, Ding Nan adjusts cloth and silk for two feet each... the male year is sixteen, half a class, eighteenth year is a regular class, sixty-six is exempt from class." "Book of Yi Zhou‧ Da Kuang": "Nonglin is divided into townships, and the township is ordered to receive food. Cheng Ke collects goods, competes and compares to Tibet." Study and lecture can also be expressed as " class". "Liangshu‧The Legend of the Scholars‧Shen Jun": "With his uncle, Tai Shi Shuming, the teacher and ancestor Shen Tushi, he spent years under his sect and taught himself day and night." " Class" also means homework. Tang Li Shangyin's "Miscellaneous Compilation-Lost Noumenon": "If you don't check students for class, don't study, you lose your master's body."

課字的基本解释

課
kè
见“课”。

課字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kè］
［《廣韻》苦卧切，去過，溪。］
［《廣韻》苦禾切，平戈，溪。］
“课1”的繁体字。
(1)检验；试用。
(2)考核；考查。
(3)评判等次；考试评定。
(4)督促。
(5)索取；要求。
(6)引申为推求。参见“課文”。
(7)谓致力于，从事。
(8)征收或交纳赋税。
(9)赋税；租税。
(10)计算。
(11)讲习；学习。
(12)功课，作业。
(13)教学的科目。
(14)教学的时间单位。
(15)教科书根据课时而分的段落。
(16)有计划的分段教学。
(17)占卜的一种。
(18)旧时某些机关、学校、工厂等分设的行政单位。
(19)同“騍”。母马。参见“課馬”。
(20)用同“窠”。巢。
(21)用同“錁”。参见“課銀”。
(22)用同“嗑”。参见“課牙”。

課字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　課； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1165第14
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?苦臥切，科去聲。【說文】試也。【廣雅】第也。【玉篇】議也。【增韻】計也，程也。【史記·匈奴傳】課校人畜計。【前漢·京房傳】房奏考功，課吏法。【晉書·元帝紀】勸課農桑。【宋書·沈約自序】少寬其工課。【汲冢周書】程課物徵。【管子·七法篇】成器不課不用，不試不藏。　又【廣韻】稅也。【舊唐書·職官志】凡賦人之制有四：一曰租，二曰調，三曰役，四曰課。　又縣名、水名。【隋書·地理志】課陽縣，屬南陽郡，因課水而名。　又【玉篇】苦訛切【廣韻】【集韻】苦禾切，?音科。課差也。　又【類篇】率也。

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［kè］
["Guangyun" lie down and cut, have been to the stream. ]
["Guang Yun" bitter he cut, Ping Ge, Xi. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "Lesson 1".
(1) Inspection; trial.
(2) Examination; examination.
(3) Judgment level; examination evaluation.
(4) Supervise.
(5) Request; request.
(6) The extension is an inference. See "Text".
(7) It means to commit to, engage in.
(8) Levy or pay taxes.
(9) Taxation; taxation.
(10) Calculation.
(11) Lecture; study.
(12) Homework, homework.
(13) Subjects taught.
(14) The time unit of teaching.
(15) The textbook is divided into paragraphs according to class hours.
(16) Planned teaching in stages.
(17) A type of divination.
(18) In the old days, some government agencies, schools, factories, etc. were divided into administrative units.
(19) Same as "骒". Mare. See "Class Horse".
(20) Use the same as "窠". nest.
(21) Use the same as "锞". See "Class Bank".
(22) Use the same as "Nit". See "class teeth".

[You Ji 1] [Words Department] 　Class; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 1165 Page 14
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? Suffering and cutting, the sound of the subject. [Said the text] Try it too. [Guang Ya] First also. [Jade articles] Discussion also. [Zeng Yun] Ji Ye, Cheng Ye. 【Historical Records · The Huns】Class School Human and Animal Accounting. [Previous Han·Beijing Fang Biography] Fang Zuo test, class staff method. [Book of Jin·Emperor of Yuan Dynasty] Advising to teach farming mulberry. [Song Shu·Shen Yue's Preface] Shao Kuan's engineering course. [Jizhong Zhoushu] Cheng Kewu levy. [Pipe·Seven Methods] The finished device does not need to be taught, nor is it tried or hidden.　[Guangyun] Tax also. [Old Tang Book·Official Records] There are four systems for Furen: one is rent, the second is tune, the third is service, and the fourth is class.　 Also the name of the county and the name of the water. [Book of Sui·Geography] Keyang County, which belongs to Nanyang County, is named after Keshui.　[Yu Pian] bitter error cut [Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] bitter he cut,? Yinke. Name meaning

kè
вм. 课
Radicals: 言, 果  (say, fruit)
Meaning Mnemonic
I always say the fruit section at the grocery should be at the front of the store. It’s the perfect place for the fruit section, I say.
Think about it. Every grocery store has the fruit section right at the front, wouldn’t you say?
Reading Mnemonic
To get to the fruit section, you have to go to the store. To get to the store you have to drive a car (か). Driving a car is the fastest way to get to the fruit section at the store.
Picture yourself driving a car and salivating over the fruit waiting for you in the fruit section. Imagine your favorite fruit as you put the pedal to the metal in your awesome car.
